website_summaries.verdict: With really good photo and video quality, a great set of features and generally class-leading performance, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX100 is probably one of our favorite compact cameras ever. It's not for the inexperienced, though.
pros: The Panasonic LX100 delivers really good photo and video quality, a great set of features, and class-leading performance
cons: It's got a fixed LCD and  the lens really needs a hood to minimize flare

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! Dust issue is still persistent, seller refuses to take return!!
customer_reviews.text: If you read enough reviews you might come across a problem with this camera where dust accumulates inside of the camera, ruining some of the photographs. I contacted the seller with this issue and they refused to refund. That aside, the camera is ok, definitely lacking some of the good software features most modern cameras have, however the picture quality and simplicity of use is good. Buy at your own risk, be aware of the seller
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my LX7 (and earlier LX5) to enjoy easy access to manual controls and upgrading to an electronic viewfinder. I'm impressed by the greater dynamic range and resolution of my photos. The camera feels good in my hands - it reminds me of my film days, using my Olympus OM1 back in the 70's! Be sure to purchase the US version from a Panasonic authorized dealer for the Triple Your Warranty promotion (check the Panasonic site.) One difference from the LX 7 is the LX100 can't focus as close for macro shots. This was disappointing at first, but maybe with the higher resolution I can crop and have them be equivalent?
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: So small yet so powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a canon T6i but because of its size I realized that I was never carrying it with me. Don't get me wrong, the camera is good, but if you're not a professional photographer you don't want to walk around carrying a big camera with you, that's why I decided to get a small one, and after MUCH (believe me) MUCH research my final top 3 were Lumix LX100, Fuji 100T and Sony rx100. I think I made the right choice and choose the best one out of these 3. I'm BEYOND impressed and pleased with Lumix.
customer_reviews.author: Andressa

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: The lens alone on this camera is worth the price (sharp, fast lens). I really enjoy shooting with this camera since it has real manual controls and I don't have to waste time searching through menus looking for a specific option (like cellphone cameras). This camera has a real aperture ring on the barrel of the lens and a real shutter speed control wheel on top of the body. Of course everything can easily be set to full auto with the touch of a real button. The four-thirds sensor is much bigger than the one-Inch sensor found on other compact cameras (it's the sensor size that really counts).
customer_reviews.author: jpard2357

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, bad connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: Camera took very good photos, and there's a lot of manual options which is great for a P&S of this size. My complaint which drove a return of the camera, was that the WiFi accessibility was abysmal. Every time I wanted to connect to my iPhone for photo sharing, I would have to go through the connection steps all over again as if it was a new phone connection. That was a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Great Point-and-Shoot Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Lumix LX100 is compact, lightweight and as easy or complicated as one makes it. I like having the option of controlling the aperture and shutter speed. It operates like an old fashioned 35mm but has modern technology that produces bright, crisp images. The Leica F1.7-2.8 lens offers wide latitude of control with outstanding results.
customer_reviews.author: bhatfield

customer_reviews.title: This camera is BS
customer_reviews.text: The main selling point of this camera is the micro four thirds and the aperture. It really doesnt matter how good specs it has but if this stops working then is no better than a phone camera. This camera got an aperture stucked and wont change rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: ALVARO GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great camera meh software
customer_reviews.text: Really one of the best point and shoots out there. The 4k video option is very nice but clips videos at 2GB so be prepared to do some stitching afterwards. HDR can be very finicky often grabbing ghost images from slight movements but if done in a controlled environment can get some good photos. WIFI sharing is a joke I would not even try wasting your time on it after wasting half a day trying to get it to sync photos it's just fast to plug the card in.
customer_reviews.author: jarble

customer_reviews.title: nice camera but.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a street camera, nice fast lens , ok sharpness, lack of tilt screen a big deal, too easy to change some setting, etc. Does more then I need but is filling a space for now. This is my carry around camera and fit in my cargo pants fine, not weather sealed. I can see using this unit for a year or so it does too many things for me as I have other cameras, for an around camera with nice video and a very nice lens then get it, just keep in mind to get the most out of this unit expect to do some reading.
customer_reviews.author: chrisking

customer_reviews.title: My sensor is filled with crap now and I can only shoot wide open to ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, for this price Panasonic could have found a way to keep the sensor clean despite the retractable lens. The lens movement transports dust and small desbris into the camera everytime it extends and retracts. This is a rediculois design flaw. My sensor is filled with crap now and I can only shoot wide open to avoid seeing the dust in my videos and images. Since the sensor is not self cleaning like on most dslr's, you are stuck with sending the unit back to Panasonic for service. I don't. Have 6 weeks to wait. I would not recommend this model because of this major design flaw. Too bad - could have been a great camwra.
customer_reviews.author: William OTP

customer_reviews.title: "The perfect camera" is the one you enjoy using
customer_reviews.text: "The perfect camera" is the one you enjoy using. This one definitely qualifies for me. It has a wonderful "retro" look. (I've been asked, "Is that a film camera?" which is fine with me.) The picture quality is excellent with the panorama feature being outstanding. The 4K video is also phenomenal as is the HD video. My one quibble is the menu structure can be maddening. Early on I kept wondering, "Where do I find that setting again?" Definitely download the advanced user guide. Also, the MegaGear leather case completes the "retro" look and protects the camera nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is superb, the zoom range generous, and the ability to control exposure settings ideal for someone looking to avoid the weight of a DSLR. I'm not getting rid of my Nikon D800s but for vacations and neighborhood strolls, this is the best solution I have found. One issue- convoluted menu makes some adjustments on the fly difficult. Burst exposure mode is a plus and it is terrific in low light situations. Photos recently taken in Bermuda were sharp and clear, albeit in Lightroom I had to boost the saturation a bit. Overall, I am extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Hyman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality on this camera is spectacular! It has pretty much replaced my dslr. It's fairly compact (though probably not going to fit in your pocket) and does pretty well in low light. Video on this is pretty amazing as well. The only problem ive ruin into is that the technology on my computer/monitor struggles a bit when trying to play full HD vids. I get the blue screen of death when I try playing vids in 4k. Did someone say time for an upgrade? ?
customer_reviews.author: laal

customer_reviews.title: A Minature Digital Leica.....
customer_reviews.text: What I've always wanted as a camera was the digital equivalent of the compact Leica CL's from the 1970's....this is that camera, with honest to god aperture ring, and shutter speed dial on top....if only they'd added an iso wheel instead of an exposure +/_ on top.....do not miss touch screen or tilt screen at all....the EVF is outstanding and you fall into it totally....fits in cargo pants pocket or jacket pocket......BRAVO!!!
customer_reviews.author: William V. DePaulo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera. An idiot can take great pics on ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. An idiot can take great pics on the auto setting, but manual controls allow greater adjustment as your skill builds. The sepia and b&w features are cool too. Its not as good as b&w film or platinum, but a heck of a lot easier and less expensive. This has become my go to camera, I may sell the Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Frank St Clair

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is excellent, and images are superb
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality camera. Build quality is excellent, and images are superb. Great color fidelity and color balance in a variety of lighting situations, low noise, and a nicely defocused background are just some of its strengths. Depth of field control is excellent due to the very fast lens. You can get a surprisingly shallow depth of field if you want to, especially with its close focusing capabilities. Out of camera JPEG's are sharp, and the 4K video and time lapse function are some of the great features that enticed me to buy this camera in the first place. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R.

customer_reviews.title: 7 lens and excellent controls for taking photos
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous camera with a very fast 1.7 lens and excellent controls for taking photos. I take HRD photos all the time for real estate and love the ability to shoot photos with up to 7 brackets. If you need a lens wider than 24 MM you are out of luck. The third party adapter lens I bought has too much barrel distortion to be useful. Camera is too large and heavy to be considered a pocket camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sullremax

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera. But you can't set shutter length past ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera. But you can't set shutter length past 4" in manual focus. So until I learn how to get around that, I can't take pics of stars, even with my phone as a remote.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great break from a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera, super fast auto-focus even in Macro mode. The battery lasted me about a week of random shooting. My only negative thing about the design of this camera is that the lens comes out when it's on. Was hoping that it only did that in the zoomed mode, but even in the widest zoom, the lens sticks out about 3.5" from the base. Hoping that getting the self-closing cap will help the look.
customer_reviews.author: Yury Sakovich

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value and performance
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible camera. Size is perfect. Weight as well. Features of a much more expensive camera. This was purchased at the recommendation of a highly regarded professional photographer and given as a gift to a mountain climber. Can't wait to see what he comes back with.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Friedland

customer_reviews.title: 7 lens is super-sharp even when pushed to higher ISO's and has wonderful bokeh. I can't say enough goo things about ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW! If you're an enthusiast, this is your go-to point-and-shoot. I often tire of lugging around my Nikon D90 yet still want the flexibility of total manual control. This camera delivers. The f1.7 lens is super-sharp even when pushed to higher ISO's and has wonderful bokeh. I can't say enough goo things about this camera. As a plus, the 4k video is unreal. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NCSurferTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Well made excellent camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for carrying all day sou yo never miss a shot. Well made with quality materials. It has become my go to camera.
customer_reviews.author: JBendig

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it says it does and more, better.
customer_reviews.text: I’m no pro, but this camera rocks. I use it specifically to take pictures for my food blog. They’re low-light generally, macro, and shot quickly without a tripod. It works like a charm. Get an automatic lens cap when you buy it. The stock one is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: David Smelson

customer_reviews.title: Sensor size for body size is good
customer_reviews.text: Works well, allows lots of light. Easy to use, light body.
customer_reviews.author: Meless

customer_reviews.title: very good camera for a point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: very good camera, the only down side is that when we shoot in 4k the camera don't have a indicator don't go red. the picture look great, not a great low light shooting.
customer_reviews.author: chung ostrander

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's light, compact and takes fantastic photos and video. I particularly like being able to take hand held night shots, photo and video, without a flash. In addition, the interface is, at least for me, very intuitive. Finally, there's a wealth of capabilities to discover.
customer_reviews.author: Rokidtoo

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best
customer_reviews.text: First, buying it through Amazon is great got it tow days later. The camera is mind blowing. Very good camera if you know how to use it manually, also good in auto mode. It is unbelievable outstanding camera. Thank you panasonic and thank you amazon..
customer_reviews.author: Sam Daymil

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-LX-100S
customer_reviews.text: Terrific camera, great Leica lens, easy to "point & shoot" or get more creative. Very sturdy and much like the larger format cameras - just easier & lighter to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Highlander

customer_reviews.title: A great compact for the serious shooter.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera with performance and features that make it one of the best. Having put several hundreds of shots through it, I can say the image quality rivals any other compact on the market and none can match its quality of construction and features. Heck, Leica rebranded it the D-Lux 109 with very few changes. My only complaint is no built-in ND filter, but a B-W ND 0.6 solved that. Highly recommended if you know your way around f/stops, shutter speeds, WB, EV+-, etc. Sure, it has what amounts to a Program mode, but if you are shopping for just a point and shoot save yourself several hundred dollars and buy just that.
customer_reviews.author: David Booker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best camera you can get at this size.
customer_reviews.author: Zhang Fang

customer_reviews.title: The manual controls are great! I love not having to fumble through a ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a photographer, but this camera never let me down. Had it delivered the day before an 8 day trip through Paris and London, learned how to use it on the plane, and took over 60 GB of pictures and 20 GB of 4K video (roughly 1GB a minute!). The manual controls are great! I love not having to fumble through a software menu to change things. Aspect ratio, light/exposure? (the -3,-2.-1,0,1,2,3 dial), the ability to switch between intelligent auto (IA) and any other chosen mode is super useful. Read a real review on a pro site if you're on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: OneRandomMexican

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera with 4K video recording
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera with 4K video recording. The 4K videos are excellent even in low light, if properly focused. The quality of images not very good compared to DSLR camera images. Very good for travelling.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and balance machine
customer_reviews.text: Small but not really compact size. Lens is excellent in low light.
customer_reviews.author: nke618

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very Good Camera for its size. They have managed a good aperture at zoom, which means a shallow depth of field and good low light performance. Flash is decent. Don't expect it to give you DSLR results and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! The sensor and autofocus on this camera are like no others. You do not need the flash in low light -- at all! And the AF is fast and crisp. This is by far the best all-purpose camera I have ever used and it's my everyday camera-of-choice. I also highly recommend the JB bamboo handle. Great combination. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas H. Van Slyck

customer_reviews.title: Complicated but worth the effort; a technically wonderful camera.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful but complicated to learn and use. NOT a point-and-shoot camera. However, it is a wonderful camera for those of us who grew up with SLR's, NIKOMAT's and real film. I strongly suggest the "Pocket Guide to the Panasonic LUMIX LX100" by Rob Knight. You need to keep this useful guide with you as you learn the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Leather1905

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera. and very good buy as the refurbished one I bought 99,5% as new
customer_reviews.text: I have still to learn most (all will be tough) options the camera has but from the beginning I was very impressed by quality of images. Also look of the camera is very nice, between a compact one and a full size interchangeable lens one. The very good quality compensates for not being able to put camera in a pocket. The horizon line that turns green when you have camera clean leveled is very nice for someone like me that tends to miss horizontality.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Schwend G

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Takes great pictures, even in low light. I haven't explored all the features yet but I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Fisher

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, easy to carry during travel
customer_reviews.text: nothing to dislike. I loved the camera! one thing. the battery charger should be universal since im in riyadh I need three prongs kind of charger. that's all.
customer_reviews.author: macchiatoaddict

customer_reviews.title: Best buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera!!! All options you can ask for in a small camera. Nice build. Photos are sharp and very well balanced. I Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: November9

customer_reviews.title: Amazing handling, with tons of manual control
customer_reviews.text: Does everything well. If you want a camera that can tackle most conditions and not weigh you down, this is it. Amazing handling, with tons of manual control. I took thousands of pictures on our honeymoon. Total novice...had a digital rebel a decade ago. Want bokeh in portraits? Done. Low light ability? Yes. It's the compact camera for someone who wants as few compromises as possible, while not having to fiddle with lenses....
customer_reviews.author: J. Pennington

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera. This camera is much better than i ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great camera. This camera is much better than i had expected it's small light and quick. Image quality is great
customer_reviews.author: ri

customer_reviews.title: This camera is everything you need!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything you need. I moved from a 5D Mark III with over $15k in lenses to THIS. Yes, you heard that right! Does it do EVERYTHING that my 5D did? ...honestly, pretty much. The video is actually better imho. Shoots 4k (I usually just stick with 1080p)... but the photo quality is insanely great too. Does great shallow depth of field, exposure comp is awesome, RAW shooting is exactly what I need/expect. I love this camera. Definitely a photographer's swiss army knife in a small package!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Theobald

customer_reviews.title: The camera is an optimal balance of quality and weight/size ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is an optimal balance of quality and weight/size. In a very compact form-factor Panasonic were able to provide flexibility and quality of basic mirror camera with decent optics. 24-75 equivalent focus distance is quite small, however full HD video and 12MP photo allows to crop photo and video keeping acceptable quality for web, screen or 5x8 prints getting actually up to 150mm of effective focus distance.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolay Gekht

customer_reviews.title: If you love manual controls and want a smaller camera this is ...
customer_reviews.text: If you love manual controls and want a smaller camera this is hard to beat. Yes there are smaller cameras with touch screens so if you want or need either of those attributes then this may not be for you. This shoots fantastic video and when synced with a smartphone you can easily shoot yourself and essentially the camera becomes a touch screen via the phone's screen. The only minor frustration is that the camera lens auto retracts after a few seconds in various menu or review screens and this cannot be turned off with the current firmware as of 8/1/2015 but maybe they'll fix that in an update as other people mention that this is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan h kypros

customer_reviews.title: great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Just the best little camera I've ever owned. The 'always have with me' camera that takes fabulous shots.
customer_reviews.author: Erigo Asparago

customer_reviews.title: A joy to have and to hold
customer_reviews.text: This is the third of the LX-series that I have owned. My first is the LX-2; my second is the LX-7. The three are lovely to look at and wonderful to use. This is the first one to have a built-in viewfinder, a feature that I have found essential for use in bright light. I searched for the camera on flickr to assess the quality of the photographs that it can produce. What I found convinced me that I must have it. I have bonded with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. WHITBY

customer_reviews.title: So happy I'm using this instead of my DSLR
customer_reviews.text: So happy I'm using this instead of my DSLR. Almost same image quality and manual controls as in my Nikon D300, but at a fraction of the size.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I got this to make sure the photo's of the work I create in my Shop (a blacksmith shop) were captured for my portfolio. I wanted something with a good range and would really make my photo's pop. I also wanted something that took reasonable video so I could make some simple videos in the shop and post them. WOW, This small camera takes amazing video, and I'm having so much fun taking pictures I might just have to start a new hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Tabasco

customer_reviews.title: The LX100 is an excellent camera for the serious "hands-on" photographer who doesn't want ...
customer_reviews.text: The LX100 is an excellent camera for the serious "hands-on" photographer who doesn't want the bulk and weight of interchangeable lenses. Has an electronic viewfinder as well as individual dials for all major control functions: aperture, shutter speed, focus, aspect ratio, focus mode, exposure compensation. Fast, high quality lens and large sensor for such a small camera. Good video capabilities. Has time lapse and remote control features. Allows for all levels of control from fully manual to fully automatic. No built-in flash, but comes with clip-on flash.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet really given this camera a proper "shake down" but so far it is behaving as expected. Despite what you may read, it can fit in a pocket but that (obviously) has to depend on the pocket of what and where. Its not as small as say a GM5 with a 28mm prime but it is smaller than the gm5 with the 42.5mm Leica DG Nocticron. I love the layout of the manual controls: shutter speed is up top on a dial, aperture is on a ring on the lens - just where an old film shooter like me would expect to find them.
customer_reviews.author: GARY SMITH

customer_reviews.title: I disappointed with the camera
customer_reviews.text: I disappointed with the camera. Its focus has an issue. Initially I thought I had some problem with my handling or not operating correctly. I have to shut it off and on few times before it would focus. I read some reviews and found other people also have similar problem with the camera. I will now try to claim its warranty. Not sure if it will be honored.
customer_reviews.author: TSA

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday carry camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is the everyday or back up camera many photographers have been wishing for. Great lens, Fast lens. Color profile of sensor is excellent, compact with classic control dials for the setting you need to adjust quickly for changing conditions. This camera is becoming one of my favorites, and I have used Sony full trame and APS, Nikon full frame and APS, Olympus 4 3. It is like Panasonic finally used our wish list for a small, high quality compact we could use like our professional cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkeling

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible camera. The low light performance is simply out of this world for a camera of this size. The lens is awesome fast F/1.7. Only thing I would like to have in the box is the auto open lens cap. Don't know why Panasonic went for the regular lens cap. It is irritating. Except that everything just rocks!!
customer_reviews.author: Abhishek Chanda

customer_reviews.title: Patience in learning will pay off with this quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Lots to learn. I made a wise choicel
customer_reviews.author: Charles Sekera

customer_reviews.title: Hairy lens...
customer_reviews.text: One year a and a few months of light use, a hair string behind the lens... A what? Hair? How could hair get in??? I am supposed to pay around $250 to have it cleaned...
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Best compact camera on the market
customer_reviews.text: Of course, there's the RX100IV, which delivers some enhanced capabilities compared to the LX100, but for all true photographers out there, who love controlling their camera, the LX100 is unrivaled.
customer_reviews.author: Eyal Gurevitch

customer_reviews.title: BAD, BAD DUST PROBLEMS!
customer_reviews.text: DUST ON THE SENSOR!! An otherwise good camera ruined by a very serious dust problem. The only way to clean the sensor is to take the camera apart. Just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Everclear

customer_reviews.title: I've had a SLR and hated carrying it cause it was big
customer_reviews.text: I've had a SLR and hated carrying it cause it was big. This camera creates just as great images but it a lot smaller. Easy for all my traveling. And the fact it has wifi and can be controlled remotely through my phone is amazing!!!!! I am also able to upload my photos immediately as well. This camera has changed my world completely. I definitely recommend this one 100%!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures... a bit complicated interface for a P&S, but good "only" camera to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: The Rao

customer_reviews.title: Great images, but very cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Great image quality, especially RAW, but it's bulky, cumbersome, and the menus are hard to navigate. And the wheel for ISO, white balance, etc., is too touchy. Not a good camera for "on the go" photography...you can't be fast with it. It attracts dust too. Wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I'm doing something wrong but I'm not getting the shallow depth of field I anticipated
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, easy to use, perfect size, great quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen A sanchez

customer_reviews.title: but folks with larger hands like myself might try one somewhere before buying
customer_reviews.text: It appears larger to me in pictures than it seems in 'real life'. It is an absolutely elegant 'pocket' camera worth the money, but folks with larger hands like myself might try one somewhere before buying. I just can't get comfortable wit the small-for-me controls, dials, and buttons. That's a shame, because the quality of build and image is first rate.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Best compact camera for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: This is very good camera if you have a Slr experience but you do not want to carry all stuff with many lenses on a camera bag. Makes better quality images compared to canon 550d with 18-135 lens. 5 star compared to size. 4 star if not take the size into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Erman C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, easy, great sensor and lens. Love the manual dials for quick adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: art Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Best camera purchase since my 6D
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. I love the clarity of the lens. And the camera control functions are great.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Kemp

customer_reviews.title: I am an avid photographer and have thousands of dollars ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid photographer and have thousands of dollars in DSLR gear. I bought this camera for convenience and travel. It is an absolutely superb product -- top flight in every detail from performance, ease of use, flexibility of use and quality. This is not a point and shoot camera for an amateur, but it can be used by an amateur on automatic. However, the true value of the camera will never be utilized if that is the extent the challenge placed on it.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir N

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is smaller than my 600D and produces images that are, in my eyes, just as good. It's lens is versatile and wide enough to shoot at night. Using it is straight forward with manual controls and dials that reduce the need to dive into menus. Oh, and the built in view finder is a much better way of composing pictures than using the (admittedly pretty good) LCD screen. This is my current take anywhere camera.
customer_reviews.author: Essa A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera, it will take some time to completely master it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Lumix LX100s in a row with focus errors
customer_reviews.text: Two failed out of the box. The first would not start up 10% of the time indicating "Focus Error". The second would only autofocus in iAuto mode, not Program, Aperture or Shutter priority modes. This is not the kind of camera one buys to shoot in Auto! Moving on to something else for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Oasis Shutterbug

customer_reviews.title: Took Two
customer_reviews.text: First one very poor image quality, sent it back and was sent a replacement ln two dsys. Second one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: But have to study photography or shoot AUTO mode. I bought through Amazon warehouse seconds & it did not state shutter count which was 16K when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera. Amazing photo and video quality even in ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. Amazing photo and video quality even in low light. These two things made me deduct one star: 1. No option to monitor what you film through the HDMI output. A firmware could fix this. 2. Few seconds delay when you push start/end record button.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These cameras seem to get better all the time, love the features!
customer_reviews.author: Misty7

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Expectation
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is not what I expected from a Leica lens. Probably going to return for credit.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Lovitt

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise excellent little camera
customer_reviews.text: If it had a slightly greater zoom range (on the long end) and an integrated lens cover I would have given it five stars. Otherwise excellent little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brockman

customer_reviews.title: huge improvement from G3
customer_reviews.text: upgraded from lumix G3. picture is sharper, and dynamic. wifi works fine. size is just about right. very responsive, and easy to change the setting.
customer_reviews.author: Philip WJS

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! Great motion shots even in low light!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This camera has one HUGE flaw. If you take ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera has one HUGE flaw. If you take a picture you can't review it. OK, you can but you have about 2 seconds and then it's gone. If you want to see what you just shot you need to hit the "play" button and then you have about 15 seconds before the lens retracts into the body. Every time. No way to adjust the retraction time. EXTREMELY frustrating and badly in need of a firmware update to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Tensenj

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs worst build quality
customer_reviews.text: 1 day of use and 2 dust particles inside the camera. Avoid at all cost. I wish I listened to all the people talking about this issue online.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Lanari Zubiaur

customer_reviews.title: I have a cheap POS Canon camera which fits easily in a pocket for pics on motorcycle trips but ...
customer_reviews.text: I come from old-school SLR film cameras so I have a lot to learn. I have a cheap POS Canon camera which fits easily in a pocket for pics on motorcycle trips but I wanted something much better quality and I think this is it.
customer_reviews.author: tlbranth

customer_reviews.title: Had to send the camera back it had a defect ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to send the camera back it had a defect. The diopter adjustment didn't work. Not Amazon's fault it. This is a common problem with the camera. See the following link:  Didn't get to evaluate the rest of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hall

customer_reviews.title: 4K and Leica Lens are perfect
customer_reviews.text: small compact super high IQ image from the M43 sensor, the best part is the fast Leica Lens, the lens alone is worth the money, with the bonus 4K video, perfect for travel cam
customer_reviews.author: QVQ

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Item Description
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived today. The item description in Key Features says: "External flash included". Well, no flash was in the box. The box the camera came in says that a flash is an "optional" accessory. Someone needs to update the item description and stop misleading people. The camera does NOT come with a flash, and it seems Amazon does not offer one for sale. So unless I plan to shoot 100% in daylight, seems I am out of luck. Camera is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Good but will be outdated shortly
customer_reviews.text: If you have big hands you may have trouble with the menus and buttons. Picture quality is good, small enough to fit in your pocket
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: but your management and customer service as always was great. Thank you
customer_reviews.text: unfotunately for government's tax impose on it I had to return it, but your management and customer service as always was great. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, except that the single area autofocus is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, except that the single area autofocus is unreliable. Front focuses very distant scenes occasionally - even though it indicates good focus. Other cameras (RX100iii, LX7) don't have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph B.

customer_reviews.title: but also better than my phone for situations where a DSLR just ...
customer_reviews.text: Magical little camera right here! I'm a Nikon D810 owner who needs something smaller, but also better than my phone for situations where a DSLR just isn't practical. The LX100 fits the bill perfectly. And as a bonus it shoots 4K video as well!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Defective Viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: The first one had a defective viewfinder (not sharp at any dioptre setting). The replacement was worse, so it also went back. Both were far worse than the accessory EVF I have for the LX7. Two stars is probably generous for this standard of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: NormC

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about the specifications of this camera but sorely disappointed after shooting with it for a while. The sharpness of the images has been a problem for many including myself. While it does improve a little with RAW it still really isn't that good. My indoor shooting was very disappointing. I was blown away that my Olympus XZ-2 was capable of higher image quality even with the much smaller sensor. Bottom line, I gave this camera away to one of the kids for their hiking adventures, which it may actually be good for, and switched back to my Olympus PEN.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but I later opted for the Olympus-Pen F, glad I made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The camera is the Japanese model. By that I ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is the Japanese model. By that I mean the set up and the in camera directions and modification can only be comprehended by an individaul that speaks and understands Japanese. This was not noted before purchase. The manufacturer (Panasonic) does not have a firmware update. I will be returning this for a camera the I can understand how to use.
customer_reviews.author: ronald bates

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect camera I ever had
customer_reviews.text: Except it is lacking of tilting screen and touch screen, the rest is perfect for me. Love it so much. My big Canon gears is almost unused now and the most important thing is, I have more pictures of my son than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Hieu Le

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing as the camera box looked to be opened when ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing as the camera box looked to be opened when we got it. It was missing a few parts, which made us a bit suspicious. Then when we went to test out the camera, it showed a System Error message and could not get it to clear. We are returning it. It is very disappointing as it was a purchase for my daughter who is leaving for an internship outside the country. We did not have enough time to order a replacement and get it before she left. And shipping outside the country adds all kinds of costs. Bummer for something that isn't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Ree

customer_reviews.title: Defective for Third Time
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a great camera according to all the reviews, but I cannot get a good copy. Just received my third replacement and all have a non-working eye diopter adjustment wheel. Panasonic's quality control took a vacation on the silver model, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: MCG

customer_reviews.title: Camera failed in less than 24 hours and fewer than 50 exposures.
customer_reviews.text: After fewer than 50 shots, the camera sensor appears to have failed. While the menuing system continued to work, when trying to photograph all I could see was a series of colored vertical lines on either the LCD display or in the viewfinder. See the attached photograph, which is what I obtained when pressing the shutter release. I am very disappointed, as I loved the form factor and the styling of this camera—and was pleased with the image quality of the few successful exposure I made. Nevertheless, I am returning it and will wait for quite awhile before repurchasing (if I ever do) so that Panasonic manufacturing can get the bugs out of their process for this model.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Tovish

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival ... Does not want to turn on, even with a fully charged battery. I had many Nikons and Canons over the years, I thought I would give Panasonic a try... I guess I will return it and buy either canon or Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chen

customer_reviews.title: BEFORE YOU BUY THE DMC-LX100 - READ THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Not a big deal to me but be warned that multiple cameras, including mine have been found to be defective. The Level indicator is WAY OFF calibration. Contacted Pannasonic and they told me to return it for another but after reading multiple thread at DPreview on the LX100, they all have the same problem. There are two threads in the Panny Forum at DPreview discussing this.
customer_reviews.author: Greg in Jax FL

customer_reviews.title: NOT 16.8MP
customer_reviews.text: Misleading advertising, it isn't 16.8MP, it is 12.7MP or less depending on the picture format selected. It is an excellent camera that deserves 5 stars, and the MP does not matter for picture quality (indeed for this size sensor it may be better with 12.7MP) just marking down because of the misleading label. If you check the Panasonic web page they don't even indicate they offer this camera in anything other than 12.7MP.
customer_reviews.author: COS

product_meta.title: PANASONIC LUMIX LX100 4K Point and Shoot Camera, 3.1X LEICA DC Vario-SUMMILUX F1.7-2.8 Lens with Power O.I.S., 12.8 Megapixel, DMC-LX100K (USA BLACK)
product_meta.description: Style:DMC-LX100K| Configuration:Camera OnlyLUMIX LX100 Integrated Leica DC Lens Zoom Camera with Advanced Controls: DMC-LX100
feature_bullets: Legendary LUMIX LX Series with manual controls Designed to Inspire Creativity
Superior light capture with large, multi aspect micro four thirds sensor
Fast f1 7-2.8, 24-75 millimeter, Leica DC zoom lens, for producing shallow depth of field (DOF) and out of focused, blur effect about the image subject
Clear and stable framing thanks to eye level EVF (2,764k-dot); Optical Image Stabilizer POWER O.I.S
Full hybrid photo experience with 30p 4K Ultra HD video and 4K photo mode; Please Refer User Manual before use
